summary: The Fog Observations and Geographic Forecasting Act mandates the Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere to undertake a project to enhance forecasts of coastal marine fog. The project aims to improve vessel safety and reduce economic impacts. It focuses on expanding marine-based observations, advancing fog modeling accuracy, improving advisory communication, and providing decision support. The Under Secretary is required to engage stakeholders, including Indian tribes, and create a detailed project plan within a year of the bill's enactment.
